sect2.title: What is Guava?
sect2.para: Google Guava is a collection of simple core Java libraries used at Google. It is a collection of utility classes and static methods reminiscent of the Apache Commons components discussed in previous chapters.

sect2.title: Problem
sect2.para: You need to use Google Guava in a project.

sect2.title: Solution
sect2.para: To use Google Guava in a Maven 2 project, add the following dependency to your project's pom.xml:

example.title: Adding a Dependency on Google Guava

sect2.para: If you are not sure what this means, I'd suggest reading Maven: The Complete Reference. When you depend on a library in Maven 2, all you need to do is add the dependency groupId, artifactId, and version to your project's dependencies. Once you do this, Maven 2 will download the dependency and make it available on your project's classpath.

sect2.title: See Also
sect2.para: For more information about the Google Guava project, see the project page at http://code.google.com/p/guava-libraries/.
